Older injuries found in child raise additional questions

The presence of old bone fractures in a 1-year-old Cambridge girl who died last week, allegedly at the hands of her nanny, has raised disturbing questions about how long she may have been abused. (Globe)
  • Grisly details emerge in nanny case | pdf Police report
  • Watch Peter Schworm on the case's grim details
  • MD Mama: Keeping children safe from abuse

Mass. home-sale prices up 12% to $300K

The median sale price for single-family homes hit $300,000 in December, up 12 percent from December of 2011, the Warren Group reported. (Globe, 6:15 a.m.)
  • Discuss Mass. housing market turning the corner?

Pictures: Banned in Massachusetts

Medical marijuana dispensaries join bottled water and styrofoam cups as being banned in some Mass. towns.
  • Melrose bans dispensaries | Malden restricts locations
  • Share What would you like banned in your town?

With new pot law, a grow-your-own effort

Entrepreneurs like Jonathan Napoli, who teaches a hydroponic growing class, are seeing a new market emerge with the new medical marijuana law. (Boston Globe)

Few hiding spots in new Facebook search

Facebook's fun, fascinating, and worrisome new search service lets you quickly find out quite a bit about your Facebook friends, or complete strangers. It's a clever idea, but not without peril. (Boston Globe)
